org.apache.juneau.rest.client2

Class RestClientBuilder

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.juneau.ContextBuilder
      • org.apache.juneau.BeanContextBuilder
        • org.apache.juneau.rest.client2.RestClientBuilder
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    MockRestClient

    public class RestClientBuilder
extends BeanContextBuilder
    Builder class for the RestClient class.

    Instances of this class are created by the following methods:

    • RestClient
      • create() - Create from scratch.
      • create(Serializer,Parser) - Create from scratch using specified serializer/parser.
      • create(Class,Class) - Create from scratch using specified serializer/parser classes.
      • builder() - Copy settings from an existing client.
    • RestClient
    • Overview > juneau-rest-client

    • Field Summary

      • Fields inherited from class org.apache.juneau.ContextBuilder

        psb

      • createHttpClientBuilder

        protected HttpClientBuilder createHttpClientBuilder()
        Creates an instance of an HttpClientBuilder to be used to create the HttpClient.

        Subclasses can override this method to provide their own client builder. The builder can also be specified using the httpClientBuilder(HttpClientBuilder) method.

        The predefined method returns an HttpClientBuilder with the following settings:

        • Lax redirect strategy.
        Returns:
        The HTTP client builder to use to create the HTTP client.

      • getHttpClientBuilder

        public HttpClientBuilder getHttpClientBuilder()
        Returns the HttpClientBuilder that will be used to create the HttpClient used by RestClient.

        This method can be used to make customizations to the HttpClient.

        If not set via httpClientBuilder(HttpClientBuilder), then this object is the one created by createHttpClientBuilder().

        Returns:
        The HttpClientBuilder that will be used to create the HttpClient used by RestClient.

      • httpClientBuilder

        public RestClientBuilder httpClientBuilder(HttpClientBuilder value)

        Parameters:

        Returns:
        This object (for method chaining).

      • createHttpClient

        protected CloseableHttpClient createHttpClient()
                                        throws Exception
        Creates an instance of an HttpClient to be used to handle all HTTP communications with the target server.

        This HTTP client is used when the HTTP client is not specified through one of the constructors or the httpClient(CloseableHttpClient) method.

        Subclasses can override this method to provide specially-configured HTTP clients to handle stuff such as SSL/TLS certificate handling, authentication, etc.

        The default implementation returns an instance of HttpClient using the client builder returned by createHttpClientBuilder().

        Returns:
        The HTTP client to use.
        Throws:
        Exception - Error occurred.

      • getHttpClient

        Returns:

      • header

        public RestClientBuilder header(String name,
                                Object value,
                                HttpPartSerializer serializer,
                                HttpPartSchema schema)
        Sets a header on all requests.

        RestClient c = RestClient .create() .header("Foo", "bar", myPartSerializer, headerSchema); .build();

        Parameters:
        name - The header name.
        value - The header value.
        • Can be any POJO.
        • Converted to a string using the specified part serializer.
        • Values are converted to strings at runtime to allow them to be modified externally.
        serializer - The serializer to use for serializing the value to a string.
        • If null, then the HttpPartSerializer defined on the client is used (OpenApiSerializer by default).
        schema - The schema object that defines the format of the output.
        • If null, defaults to HttpPartSchema.DEFAULT.
        • Only used if serializer is schema-aware (e.g. OpenApiSerializer).
        Returns:
        This object (for method chaining).

      • header

        public RestClientBuilder noTrace()
        When called, No-Trace: true is added to requests.

        This gives the opportunity for the servlet to not log errors on invalid requests. This is useful for testing purposes when you don't want your log file to show lots of errors that are simply the results of testing.

      • query

        public RestClientBuilder query(String name,
                               Object value,
                               HttpPartSerializer serializer,
                               HttpPartSchema schema)
        Adds a query parameter to the URI.
        Parameters:
        name - The parameter name.
        value - The parameter value.
        • Can be any POJO.
        • Converted to a string using the specified part serializer.
        • Values are converted to strings at runtime to allow them to be modified externally.
        serializer - The serializer to use for serializing the value to a string.
        • If null, then the HttpPartSerializer defined on the client is used (OpenApiSerializer by default).
        schema - The schema object that defines the format of the output.
        • If null, defaults to HttpPartSchema.DEFAULT.
        • Only used if serializer is schema-aware (e.g. OpenApiSerializer).
        Returns:
        This object (for method chaining).

        Parameters:
        name - The parameter name.
        value - The parameter value.
        • Can be any POJO.
        • Converted to a string using the specified part serializer.
        • Values are converted to strings at runtime to allow them to be modified externally.
        Returns:
        This object (for method chaining).

      • executorService

        public RestClientBuilder executorService(ExecutorService executorService,
                                         boolean shutdownOnClose)
        Configuration property: Executor service.

        Defines the executor service to use when calling future methods on the RestRequest class.

        This executor service is used to create Future objects on the following methods:

        • RestRequest.runFuture()

        The default executor service is a single-threaded ThreadPoolExecutor with a 30 second timeout and a queue size of 10.

        • RestClient.RESTCLIENT_executorService
        • RestClient.RESTCLIENT_executorServiceShutdownOnClose
        Parameters:
        executorService - The executor service.
        shutdownOnClose - Call ExecutorService.shutdown() when RestClient.close() is called.
        Returns:
        This object (for method chaining).

      • maxDepth

        public RestClientBuilder maxDepth(int value)
        Configuration property: Max serialization depth.

        Abort serialization if specified depth is reached in the POJO tree.
        If this depth is exceeded, an exception is thrown.
        This prevents stack overflows from occurring when trying to serialize models with recursive references.

      • beanClassVisibility

        public RestClientBuilder beanClassVisibility(Visibility value)
        Description copied from class: BeanContextBuilder
        Configuration property: Minimum bean class visibility.

        Classes are not considered beans unless they meet the minimum visibility requirements.

        For example, if the visibility is PUBLIC and the bean class is protected, then the class will not be interpreted as a bean class and will be treated as a string.

        • BeanContext.BEAN_beanClassVisibility
        Overrides:
        beanClassVisibility in class BeanContextBuilder
        Parameters:
        value - The new value for this property.
        The default is Visibility.PUBLIC.
        Returns:
        This object (for method chaining).

      • beanConstructorVisibility

        Only look for constructors with the specified minimum visibility.

        Overrides:
        beanConstructorVisibility in class BeanContextBuilder

      • beanFilters

        public RestClientBuilder beanFilters(Object... values)
        Description copied from class: BeanContextBuilder
        Configuration property: Bean filters.

        This is a programmatic equivalent to the @Bean annotation.
        It's useful when you want to use the Bean annotation functionality, but you don't have the ability to alter the bean classes.

        • BeanContext.BEAN_beanFilters
        Overrides:
        beanFilters in class BeanContextBuilder
        Parameters:
        values - The values to add to this property.
        Values can consist of any of the following types:
        • Any bean class that specifies a value for @Bean(typeName).
        • Any subclass of BeanDictionaryList containing a collection of bean classes with type name annotations.
        • Any subclass of BeanDictionaryMap containing a mapping of type names to classes without type name annotations.
        • Any array or collection of the objects above.
        Returns:
        This object (for method chaining).

      • annotations

        public RestClientBuilder annotations(Annotation... values)
        Description copied from class: BeanContextBuilder
        Configuration property: Annotations.

        Defines annotations to apply to specific classes and methods.

        Allows you to dynamically apply Juneau annotations typically applied directly to classes and methods. Useful in cases where you want to use the functionality of the annotation on beans and bean properties but do not have access to the code to do so.

        As a rule, any Juneau annotation with an on() method can be used with this property.

        The following example shows the equivalent methods for applying the @Bean annotation:

        // Class with explicit annotation. @Bean(bpi="street,city,state") public class A {...} // Class with annotation applied via @BeanConfig public class B {...} // Java REST method with @BeanConfig annotation. @RestMethod(...) @BeanConfig( annotations={ @Bean(on="B", bpi="street,city,state") } ) public void doFoo() {...}

        Concrete implementations of annotations are also provided that can be passed directly into serializer and parser builder classes:

        BeanAnnotation a = new BeanAnnotation("B").bpi("street,city,state"); WriterSerializer ws = JsonSerializer.create().annotations(a).build(); String json = ws.serialize(a);

        The following is the list of concrete annotations provided that can be constructed and passed into the builder class:

        • BeanAnnotation
        • BeancAnnotation
        • BeanIgnoreAnnotation
        • BeanpAnnotation
        • ExampleAnnotation
        • NamePropertyAnnotation
        • ParentPropertyAnnotation
        • SwapAnnotation
        • UriAnnotation
        • CsvAnnotation
        • HtmlAnnotation
        • JsoAnnotation
        • JsonAnnotation
        • SchemaAnnotation
        • MsgPackAnnotation
        • OpenApiAnnotation
        • PlainTextAnnotation
        • SoapXmlAnnotation
        • UonAnnotation
        • UrlEncodingAnnotation
        • XmlAnnotation
        • BeanContext.BEAN_annotations
        Overrides:
        annotations in class BeanContextBuilder
        Parameters:
        values - The values to add to this property.
        Returns:
        This object (for method chaining).

      • applyAnnotations

        public RestClientBuilder applyAnnotations(Class<?>... fromClasses)
        Description copied from class: ContextBuilder
        Applies any of the various @XConfig annotations on the specified class to this context.

        Applies any of the following annotations:

        • BeanConfig
        • CsvConfig
        • HtmlConfig
        • HtmlDocConfig
        • JsoConfig
        • JsonConfig
        • JsonSchemaConfig
        • MsgPackConfig
        • OpenApiConfig
        • ParserConfig
        • PlainTextConfig
        • SerializerConfig
        • SoapXmlConfig
        • UonConfig
        • UrlEncodingConfig
        • XmlConfig
        • RdfConfig

        Annotations are appended in the following order:

        1. On the package of this class.
        2. On interfaces ordered parent-to-child.
        3. On parent classes ordered parent-to-child.
        4. On this class.
        Overrides:
        applyAnnotations in class BeanContextBuilder
        Parameters:
        fromClasses - The classes on which the annotations are defined.
        Returns:
        This object (for method chaining).

      • applyAnnotations

        public RestClientBuilder applyAnnotations(Method... fromMethods)
        Description copied from class: ContextBuilder
        Applies any of the various @XConfig annotations on the specified method to this context.

        Applies any of the following annotations:

        • BeanConfig
        • CsvConfig
        • HtmlConfig
        • HtmlDocConfig
        • JsoConfig
        • JsonConfig
        • JsonSchemaConfig
        • MsgPackConfig
        • OpenApiConfig
        • ParserConfig
        • PlainTextConfig
        • SerializerConfig
        • SoapXmlConfig
        • UonConfig
        • UrlEncodingConfig
        • XmlConfig
        • RdfConfig

        Annotations are appended in the following orders:

        1. On the package of the method class.
        2. On interfaces ordered parent-to-child.
        3. On parent classes ordered parent-to-child.
        4. On the method class.
        5. On this method and matching methods ordered parent-to-child.
        Overrides:
        applyAnnotations in class BeanContextBuilder
        Parameters:
        fromMethods - The methods on which the annotations are defined.
        Returns:
        This object (for method chaining).

      • evictExpiredConnections

        public RestClientBuilder evictExpiredConnections()
        Makes this instance of HttpClient proactively evict expired connections from the connection pool using a background thread.
        • One MUST explicitly close HttpClient with Closeable.close() in order to stop and release the background thread.
        • This method has no effect if the instance of HttpClient is configured to use a shared connection manager.
        • This method may not be used when the instance of HttpClient is created inside an EJB container.
        Returns:
        This object (for method chaining).
        See Also:
        HttpClientBuilder.evictExpiredConnections()

      • evictIdleConnections

        public RestClientBuilder evictIdleConnections(long maxIdleTime,
                                              TimeUnit maxIdleTimeUnit)
        Makes this instance of HttpClient proactively evict idle connections from the connection pool using a background thread.
        • One MUST explicitly close HttpClient with Closeable.close() in order to stop and release the background thread.
        • This method has no effect if the instance of HttpClient is configured to use a shared connection manager.
        • This method may not be used when the instance of HttpClient is created inside an EJB container.
        Parameters:
        maxIdleTime - New property value.
        maxIdleTimeUnit - New property value.
        Returns:
        This object (for method chaining).
        See Also:
        HttpClientBuilder.evictIdleConnections(long,TimeUnit)
